intro: Leucospora multifida, commonly known as the hairy leucospora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Leucospora multifida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate foliage and compact growth habit.
